thread.title: Oscars 2017: Viola Davis wins Best Supporting Actress
thread.title_full: Oscars 2017: Viola Davis wins Best Supporting Actress

author: Rappler.com
title: Oscars 2017: Viola Davis wins Best Supporting Actress
text:
Oscars 2017: Viola Davis wins Best Supporting Actress Viola Davis wins for her performance in 'Fences' Published 10:46 AM, February 27, 2017 Updated 10:47 AM, February 27, 2017 File photo by Tommaso Boddi/Getty Images for Women In Film/AFP 
MANILA, Philippines – At the 2017 Academy Awards ceremony on Sunday, February 26 (February 27 in Manila), Viola Davis took home the Oscar for Best Supporting Actress for her performance in Fences. 
Fences is directed by Denzel Washington, who also stars, and is based on the play by the late writer August Wilson. In the film, Denzel plays Troy Maxson, who juggles tense relationships with his wife Rose (Viola Davis), his brother, and his son. Struggling with coming to terms with failures in his past, he battles his demons in the present, and the impact of his actions ripples onto the lives of those nearest and dearest to him. 
Last year’s Best Supporting Actor winner Mark Rylance presented this year’s victor, praising women as being better able to “oppose without hatred.” 
This is Viola's first Oscar and 3rd nomination. 
Viola beat Naomi Harris (Moonlight), Nicole Kidman (Lion), Octavia Spencer (Hidden Figures) and Michelle Williams (Manchester by the Sea). – Rappler.com HOW DOES THIS STORY MAKE YOU FEEL? Happy
